origin: Germany, though often associated with France

medium.note: Recognized in some countries but not by the AKC

history.origin: Developed as a water retriever in Germany.
history.popularity: Became popular in France as a companion dog and performer.
history.cultural_significance: Often depicted in art and literature; associated with elegance and sophistication.
history.evolution: Descended from Barbet and Hungarian Water Hound.

care.exercise: Requires daily physical and mental stimulation; enjoys walks, runs, swimming, and interactive games.
care.grooming: Needs regular grooming to prevent matting; professional grooming recommended every 4-6 weeks. Daily brushing is ideal.
care.training: Highly trainable; excels in obedience, agility, and various dog sports. Positive reinforcement methods work best.
care.diet: Should be fed high-quality dog food appropriate for age, size, and activity level. Portion control is important to prevent obesity.
care.socialization: Early socialization recommended to develop well-rounded behavior. Exposure to different environments, people, and animals is beneficial.
care.living_conditions: Adaptable to various living situations but thrives in homes where they receive ample attention and activity.

interesting_facts: Poodles come in three officially recognized sizes: Standard, Miniature, and Toy. Some countries also recognize a Medium or Klein size.
They are the second most intelligent dog breed, according to Stanley Coren's 'The Intelligence of Dogs.'
Their name comes from the German word 'Pudel,' meaning 'to splash in water.'
Poodles have been used for truffle hunting due to their keen noses.
The elaborate grooming styles originated to protect vital organs and joints in cold water while hunting.
Standard Poodles were originally bred as water retrievers.
Poodles have a history of performing in circuses due to their intelligence and trainability.

additional_information.hypoallergenic: Poodles are considered hypoallergenic because they shed minimally, producing less dander.

famous_poodles.name: Foo-Foo
famous_poodles.notes: Often appeared with the pianist during performances.

famous_poodles.name: Boy
famous_poodles.owner: King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette

additional_information.breed_specific_laws: Some regions have regulations on grooming styles for show competitions.
training_tips: Provide mental stimulation through puzzle toys.
Enroll in obedience classes to enhance skills.

nutrition.diet_type: High-quality dry or wet dog food.
nutrition.feeding_schedule: 2 meals per day for adults; 3-4 meals for puppies.
nutrition.special_requirements: Monitor for food allergies; avoid overfeeding to prevent obesity.

breeding.breeding_recommendations: Health screenings for genetic issues recommended before breeding.

behavior.chewing: Can be an issue if not exercised adequately.
behavior.herding: Not a herding breed but may exhibit herding behaviors.

unsuitable_for: People unwilling to commit to grooming needs
